title: Synthetic Recap
body:
DETROIT (AP) – In a game defined by grit and a singular, historic force, the Detroit Pistons leaned on the superhuman will of Grant Hill to outlast the Orlando Magic, 91-86, in a late-season battle.

This was not a game won by committee; it was a performance authored by one man. Grant Hill, with the weight of the franchise on his shoulders, delivered a masterpiece for the ages, pouring in a career-high and breathtaking 46 points. From the opening tip, Hill was unanswerable, slicing through the lane with his signature grace and hitting from the perimeter with cold-blooded efficiency. He was the piston that powered the entire Detroit engine, accounting for over half of his team's total points in a display of sheer individual brilliance.

Orlando, led by a valiant 23-point effort from Penny Hardaway, refused to go quietly. They matched the Pistons’ physicality, with Horace Grant pulling down 13 rebounds in the trenches. But every time the Magic threatened to seize momentum, Hill had an answer—a driving layup, a pull-up jumper, a pair of free throws. His 46 points were a sledgehammer, methodically breaking down Orlando’s resolve.

The final score tells a story of a close contest, but the narrative belongs solely to Grant Hill. On this night, he wasn't just the best player on the floor; he was a force of nature, carrying his team to a crucial victory with one of the most spectacular scoring barrages the league had witnessed that season. It was a performance for the time capsule, a reminder that even in a team sport, one man's greatness can sometimes be enough.
